title: Powered Elbow Exoskeleton Reduces Fatigue, Injuries
desc: Engineers at the University of Texas at Arlington have developed a soft robotic exoskeleton that promises to help workers in jobs that require hours of lifting and repetitive motion by reducing the load. The Pneumatically Actuated Soft Elbow Exoskeleton (PASE) uses a lightweight silicone “pneumatic actuator” – a soft, air-filled mechanism that helps move the … Continued
